Uses of Class
Model.Customer

  • Packages that use Customer 
    Package Description
    Model  

    • Uses of Customer in Model

      Methods in Model that return Customer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Customer Customer.createCustomerInstanceFromHashMap(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data)
      Creates and returns an instance of a Customer object based on the paired values in a HashMap, where the key is a String representing the names of variables of a Customer object and the values are the values to be assigned to those variables.
      Customer AppointmentDatabase.getCustomerFromDb(java.lang.String customerName, Address address, java.lang.Boolean active)
      Retrieves a Customer from the database if it already exists, OR adds a new row in the Customer table in the database representing a new customer if the customer does not already exists and returns a new instance of the Customer object.
      Customer AppointmentDatabase.getCustomerWithId(int customerId)
      Allows the user to access an instance of a Customer using the customerId value.
      Methods in Model that return types with arguments of type Customer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Customer> AppointmentDatabase.getCustomers()
      Returns a HashMap that maps the customerIds to the Customer objects.
      Methods in Model with parameters of type Customer 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean AppointmentDatabase.removeCustomer(Customer customer)
      Removes a customer from the Customer table in the database as well as removes the corresponding Customer instance from the AppointmentDatabase singleton instance.
